bug.short_desc: DateField should not fire "changeValue" after locale change, which it does because the underlying ComboBox value changes

long_desc.thetext:
This is a philosophical problem, but IMHO the "value" of the DateField has not changed just because the underlying ComboBox now displays the same "value" in a different "presentation" (after all you read a Date object, not the string, and that object remains identical in "value").
Also IMHO a custom set DateFormat should not be replaced on locale change as well. I believe the dynlocale variant should only change stuff in its "default" state.
Reproduce: *) create DateField *) setDateFormat, e.g. yyyy-MM-dd, which neither English nor German locales use *) addListener('changeValue') *) change locale *) event will fire, even though the Date object will still be the same (so IMHO it is not a change in value) *) the DateFormat gets replaced with the default for the new language
I do not believe turning of dynlocale is "correct", because basically I want it, but it should not cause changeValue and maybe (again, philosophical) not replace a custom-set DateFormat
